Recipe.title: 3rd Degree Buffalo Wings
Recipe.Description:
When Ransom made his first attempt at this recipe, he left the room while the oil heated (with the lid on). When he came back, the oil was smoking, so he lifted the lid to let it cool.
Long story short, it burst into flames, splashed on his hand, arm and foot causing 1st, 2nd and near 3rd degree burns. (The docs all said it was 3rd degree, but it healed without surgery, so they changed their mind.) And it melted the microwave oven above the stove, totally destroying it.
With Joshua's help, they got the lid back on the pan, then used baking soda to put out the rest of the fire shortly before the firemen showed up.
Only a few days later, with his foot and arm bandaged up, Ransom managed to finish cooking these and they turned out great!

section.title: Wings
section.instruction: In a large bowl mix together the Flour, Paprika, Cayenne Pepper and Salt.
Place Chicken Wings in mixture and stir until they are well coated.

Cover bowl and refrigerate for 60 to 90 minutes.
(While waiting, make sauce)
Heat Oil in a deep fryer to 375°
Fry Chicken Wings in hot oil for 10 to 15 minutes, until they begin to turn brown.
Place cooked Chicken Wings into a large bowl or pan.
Coat Chicken Wings with sauce and stir until covered.

section.title: Sauce
section.instruction: In a small saucepan, combine Butter, Hot Sauce, Pepper and Garlic Powder.
Over low heat, stir together until Butter is melted and mixture is well blended.
Remove from heat and let stand until Wings are done cooking.
